intro: Ferula mikraskythiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferula, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and its taproot is thick and fleshy. Ferula mikraskythiana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic effects.
